review: Love being able to push media from any of the apple devices in my home. Renting movies on iTunes is very convenient. It's easy to set up just plain works - you can even access your iTunes library on your Mac from this device and stream whatever is there.

review: I have one at home and at work.  We use at home for movies, tv, music, and pictures.  At work we airplay our pictures, emails and anything else we have on our ipads and iphones.  works flawlessly and will eventually replace your cable subscription.
author: Richard Regitano Jr

review: Apple TV has a serious contents issue - Every stream service cost money and/or more expensive than Roku. For instance, same movie cost more to rent from Apple TV than from Roku. Unless you have definite needs or you're an "applenatic"; the Roku box is a much better buy.Another problem is its wireless capabilities, although both the Apple TV and the Roku boxes are located next to each other, the Roku box can stream faster and more consistently than Apple TV (go figure!). If you do decide to still buy an Apple TV, then make sure to connect it using ethernet, no wireless
